intro: Freirea andina, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Freirea andina is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
